<h1 align="center">
  Gatsby portfolio base Gatsby's default starter
</h1>

## ðŸš€ Quick start

1.  **Clone a Gatsby portfolio site.**

    Clone from git

    ```shell
    # clone a Gatsby portfolio site using the git
    git clone https://github.com/phuoc94/phuocnguyen.fi.git
    ```

1.  **Start developing.**

    Navigate into your new siteâ€™s directory and start it up.

    ```shell
    cd gatsby-portfolio/
    npm install
    gatsby develop
    ```

1.  **Open the source code and start editing!**

    Your site is now running at `http://localhost:8000`!

    _Note: You'll also see a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you can use to experiment with querying your data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/tutorial/part-five/#introducing-graphiql)._

    Open the `gatsby-portfolio` directory in your code editor of choice and edit `src/pages/index.js`. Save your changes and the browser will update in real time!

1.  **gatsby build**
    Build

    ```shell
    gatsby build
    ```

1.  **Firebase**

    ```shell
    firebase login
    firebase init
    ```

    'Enter'
    Hosting: Configure and deploy Firebase Hosting sites
    'Enter'\*4


    ```shell
    firebase use websites-2c968
    firebase deploy
    ```
